meanings.definition: to make a continuous, rattling sound
meanings.sent1: The wind clitters through the leaves on the trees.
meanings.sent2: The old windows clitters in the strong wind.
meanings.sent3: The loose change in his pocket clitters like tiny bells.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter clitters through the room, infectious and joyful.
meanings.sent5: The hail clitters against the roof, creating a cacophony of noise.

meanings.sent1: The clitters of the train passing by could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent2: The clitters of the falling rocks echoed in the canyon.
meanings.sent3: The clitters of the pots and pans in the kitchen signaled dinner was ready.
meanings.sent4: The clitters of the keys jingling in her handbag were a familiar sound.
meanings.sent5: The clitters of the typewriter filled the room with a comforting rhythm.

meanings.definition: characterized by a continuous, rattling sound
meanings.sent1: The clitters wind chime added a soothing melody to the garden.
meanings.sent2: The clitters old car had seen better days but still ran smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The clitters old clock on the wall never seemed to keep the right time.
meanings.sent4: The clitters sound of the waterfall was a constant presence in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The clitters sound of the cicadas filled the summer night with music.
